column1: Missouri is in a dire situation as #COVID19 continues to spread. We have to come together as a state to bring down our rate of infection. That means staying home. Wearing a mask if you have no choice but to leave. Social distancing at all times. PLEASE be vigilant. https://t.co/Qbcy1EU5se
If you need to get tested for #COVID19 there are several locations to do so in @JacksonCountyMO. More information on testing sites below: https://t.co/Ng7VtuZDJs

This decision makes absolutely no sense and needs to be reversed immediately. As the #COVID19 crisis worsens we should not be removing emergency tools that have been life-saving to small businesses and the economy as a whole that @federalreserve says are still needed. https://t.co/NEo0tp3PlE

As #COVID19 continues to surge across the country American families workers and small businesses are being crushed. The Senate and current Administration can no longer wait to provide relief #ForThePeople.   The people need it now. #HeroesAct https://t.co/ilQcmd5ZfN

If the SENATE doesn’t act 12 million Americans could lose unemployment aid by the end of the year.   @HouseDemocrats have passed multiple bills to extend unemployment benefits while the Senate sits idly watching #COVID19 crush American workers and small businesses. https://t.co/CpjJMHUaZt

Missouri is not alone. The #COVID19 pandemic has been devastating to state and local budgets across the country which is why it’s critical for Congress to pass the #HeroesAct to ensure states can keep up critical services our communities rely on every day. https://t.co/VskSqTHGIH

Masks have proven effective in reducing the spread of this deadly virus. We can crush #COVID19 but we have to work together to do it. Please look out for your fellow Americans and #WearAMask https://t.co/qAA1TFwmxY

.@HouseDemocrats passed multiple bills to combat #COVID19 months ago because it was entirely obvious our nation would be in this vulnerable position. Rather than provide additional relief #ForThePeople the Senate is still focused on confirming judges and appointments.   Shameful https://t.co/NckjXNrjMm

Missouri   We currently have one of the 10 highest rates of infection in the country. PLEASE take #COVID19 seriously and take the precautions necessary to save lives. Stay home whenever possible. Practice proper social distancing. Wear a mask. https://t.co/zi817BgZX1

With winter just around the corner we’re seeing a flashing warning that #COVID19 is spiraling out of control. We must put politics aside and come together to crush this deadly virus by staying home whenever possible practicing proper social distancing & always wearing a mask! https://t.co/07whFRubbZ
While we are one step closer to defeating #COVID19 we are not out of the woods yet. Please continue to stay home social distance and wear a mask!

While the Admin. is focused on conspiracies #COVID19 is spiraling out of control. We cannot wait to pass a relief bill to provide the resources and economic aid needed crush the virus and keep families and small businesses afloat while we do so. We need the #HeroesAct NOW! https://t.co/V4YpIPgYaH

Hospital beds are filling fast and we’re running low on staff available to care for remaining spaces. Wearing a mask will help prevent the use of more drastic measures if hospitals are overrun.   If you absolutely must leave the house please social distance and wear a mask!

Kansas City   PLEASE take #COVID19 seriously. We are at the point of uncontrolled spread across the metro area and the winter is going to be catastrophic if we don’t get our act together. https://t.co/mgfx3fHymP

If you have been in contact with someone who tested positive for #COVID19 make sure you get tested. You can call @KCMO311 to make an appointment and get more information here: https://t.co/g3qUG4o2xK https://t.co/W8NvK2ROng

Yesterday the United States set a new record with over 107000 new #COVID19 cases. We’re seeing hospitalizations and deaths rising significantly as well. We MUST come together and take proper precautions to #StopTheSpread. https://t.co/NJEGfM0KVs

As our nation witnesses the worst surge of #COVID19 yet the President wants to fire our leading expert on infectious diseases because Dr. Fauci refuses to praise this Administration’s abject failure to combat the virus. https://t.co/pW7GPaW9sC

I understand that we are tired of #COVID19 but we all must understand that the virus is not tired of us. For the sake of your family friends and fellow Americans PLEASE take the precautions necessary to #StopTheSpread

We’re currently seeing roughly 1000 Americans die from #COVID19 daily. At this rate that number will continue to rise as hospitals get overwhelmed something we’re already seeing in Kansas City. https://t.co/h5izuT6AQx

We are seeing a terrifying rise in #COVID19 cases in nearly every state in our union. If we don’t work together to flatten the curve immediately we’re going to see a catastrophic winter.   Wash your hands. Wear a mask. Social distance. No large gatherings. https://t.co/kDucJURDHo

8 months after #COVID19 devastated our economy jobless claims remain extraordinarily high.   How high?   751000 jobless claims would have shattered the record high of any week before #COVID19.  It’s good to see the number decreasing but we have a ways to go. https://t.co/4ddbCTYD5T

And because the Administration has completely failed to control #COVID19 leading to the latest surge and record infections there is certainly reason to be concerned going forward.   Remember we cannot completely recover until we crush the virus.
Accounting for all 3 quarters the U.S. economy has shrunk by 3.5% since #COVID19 came to our shores.   We’re still digging out of the hole. https://t.co/dXUqVu0n86

Putting politics before science is what lead to 225000 Americans dying from #COVID19. If we continue to do the same with #ClimateChange the results will be catastrophic. We must not bury our heads in the sand. We must #ActOnClimate! https://t.co/vT8AbVhxos

We cannot continue to wish away this deadly virus. We need to work together to crush #COVID19. That means: -Wear a mask when outdoors; -Avoid large indoor gatherings; -Practice social distancing when small gatherings are essential; -Wash your hands frequently.

225000 Americans have died.   8.7 million have been infected.   And the United States has seen its highest number of new #COVID19 cases in the past 2 days.   We’re not rounding the corner we’re running into a tsunami. https://t.co/PfMnuud1cP

We are not rounding the corner of the #COVID19 crisis we’re walking straight into the next wave which could be a tsunami. We have to pass the #HeroesAct to provide the resources needed to crush this virus and protect American families and small businesses. The Senate must act! https://t.co/A8hbDf94MD

With another 1.1 million Americans filing unemployment claims last week it marks 31 consecutive weeks with more jobless claims than the worst week of the Great Recession. With tens of millions out of work and nearly 10 million infected by #COVID19 the Senate GOP refuses to act. https://t.co/AFwbaD4ogM

We’re seeing similar surges in hospitalizations in Kansas City as well. We have to work together to slow the spread of #COVID19 before it overwhelms our health care system and causes even more unnecessary tragedy.  Avoid indoor gatherings. Practice social distancing. Wear a mask. https://t.co/uDV9oPPt2f

We may be tired of the virus but the virus is not tired of us.   As #COVID19 cases surge in Missouri and across the nation please continue to avoid large indoor gatherings practice social distancing wash your hands frequently & wear a mask!  https://t.co/EmQPYJvY9n

Black-owned small businesses have been devastated by the #COVID19 pandemic which is why @HouseDemocrats and I are fighting to provide real relief to them with the #HeroesAct.   The GOP Senate’s latest proposal simply does not meet the moment. https://t.co/iUf9PRy1Do

Failure to listen to the science and our public health experts is why we have 220000 Americans dead from #COVID19 with another 8 million infected.   Not only has the Administration not learned they’re doubling down on their anti-science approach. https://t.co/vPsBRzTHdB

Over 90% of Black-owned small businesses that applied for PPP loans were denied leading to over 40% of black-owned small businesses being shuttered during #COVID19 pandemic. And it wasn’t much better for Hispanic- Asian- or women-owned small biz. https://t.co/JL9CUNpET8

Missouri is seeing a record rise in #COVID19 cases so please be careful and wear a mask! If you think you may have been exposed make sure to get a FREE test at one of the sites below: https://t.co/4AZoJfGs98

Herd immunity which would lead to the deaths of millions of Americans is not the answer to combatting coronavirus as Dr. Fauci explains here.   What we need is a national mask mandate a national testing strategy & significant economic relief to families and small businesses. https://t.co/WUh47MQ2iW

36 states have seen significant increases in #COVID19 cases in the past week. We’re seeing hospitalizations rise as well. We are not through the worst of the storm so please continue to avoid crowds social distance & wear masks when leaving the house! https://t.co/Lq5OPscNdv

Missouri like most of the nation continues to see a rise in #COVID19 cases and hospitalizations. We have to come together as Americans and take the proper precautions that will keep our families and neighbors safe. https://t.co/yMRSqygSXj

Whether he’s too afraid to stand up to the Freedom Caucus or thinks he can hold the economy hostage as a political ploy the American people will be the ones suffering for years to come. His response to the coronavirus crisis has been a complete and unmitigated disaster.

Restaurants in #MO05 and across the country have been devastated by #COVID19. That’s why @HouseDemocrats included $120 billion specifically for restaurants and their 11 million workers in the #HeroesAct.   The Senate must act! https://t.co/9sDvzb8n16

#COVID19 is an incredibly contagious virus that has killed over 205000 Americans.    If you don’t have the best health care in the world as the President does you should be very careful and take precautions when leaving your house like wearing a mask and social distancing. https://t.co/ujiH7a1Wq7

PLEASE take #COVID19 seriously and look out for your fellow Americans by wearing a mask and practicing proper social distancing.   We can save tens of thousands of lives but we have to work together. https://t.co/YTW5BeRxN9

The rich or the poor; Republican or Democrat; the President or the public.   No one is immune from #COVID19.   Please wear a mask and practice proper social distancing when leaving your home.   We can and will make it through this storm but we must do it together.
I wish the President and First Lady a swift and complete recovery from COVID-19. Tonight I will pray for them as I have for millions of other Americans suffering from this vicious virus.

Families are facing a financial crisis.   .@HouseDemocrats are about to pass our 2nd #COVID19 relief package that would deliver a second round of stimulus checks #ForThePeople.   What are the Administration and Senate Majority Leader waiting for? https://t.co/dvlxTCQ97y

Whether it was calling the virus a “hoax” promoting untested medications or intentionally misleading the American people about the deadliness of #COVID19 Americans have paid the price of the President’s misinformation.   The cost has been tens of thousands of lives. https://t.co/DLSuzDAYSo

He believes protecting the stock market is more important than protecting American lives from #COVID19. He believes people are suckers for paying their fair share.   He has governed this way because this is who he is.   We should pay attention.

As we kick off #SmallBusinessWeek I want to recognize the over 530000 small businesses in Missouri that have supported our communities throughout the #COVID19 crisis.  Now Congress must pass the #HeroesAct to give truly small businesses the resources needed to keep doors open! https://t.co/S0jHeLJanq

Americans are sick and tired of politicians working for the power rather than #ForThePeople. Instead of rushing to fill a #SCOTUS vacancy the Administration should focus on passing a stimulus bill that will bring relief to the public and help slow the spread of #COVID19

As we near the grim milestone of 200000 Americans dead from #COVID19 the Administration continues to feel more urgency to pack the courts than bring relief to the American people. https://t.co/pbIOXtuKmq

As we seek to rebuild from the health & economic calamity caused by #COVID19 we must not settle for a return to the status quo. We should build back in a way that directly combats #ClimateChange and the inequalities we see in every sector from public health to public housing.

The #COVID19 pandemic has taken a mental toll on everyone including our children. As we continue to recognize #SuicidePreventionMonth we must ensure that schools have the tools and resources needed to identify and assist students who may be struggling with their #MentalHealth.

As we recognize the beauty of #HispanicHeritageMonth let us also recommit to fighting for a living wage for ALL Americans. Let us come together to fix our broken immigration system and let us ensure that Latino communities have the resources they need to combat #COVID19.

As Missouri surpassed 100K cases over the weekend testing remains crucial to combating #COVID19. @JacksonCountyHD is hosting FREE tests for the community. Asymptomatic individuals are encouraged to call 404-CARE to schedule a test at one of @TrumanMedKC hospital locations. https://t.co/OomYtI8Hol

#COVID19 has been overwhelming for millions of Americans.   It’s okay to feel worried or anxious about the days ahead but know that you’re not alone and that help is out there.   If you need to talk to someone don’t hesitate to call @800273TALK   #WorldSuicidePreventionDay
#TrumpKnew.   And he said nothing.   How many lives could have been saved if Trump had been honest with the American people about the danger posed by #COVID19? https://t.co/FLh7N9nH33

As #COVID19 continues to infect tens of thousands of Americans every day it’s more important than ever for everyone to get their annual #FluShot. Do your part and get a flu shot today! https://t.co/XbbDCHpU79

Missouri has one of the 10 highest rates of #COVID19 transmission in the nation.   We cannot fool ourselves into thinking we are out of the woods yet.   For the sake of our family friends neighbors workers and businesses PLEASE continue to wear a mask and social distance! https://t.co/gLFuqyafVd

.@RoyBlunt and I were happy to host a constructive conversation with community leaders in Kansas City this afternoon. As we continue to seek solutions to the #COVID19 pandemic and ensuing economic crisis it’s imperative that we receive input from the community. https://t.co/mdDYC92JTw

Today is #NationalPollWorkerRecruitmentDay! Due to the #COVID19 pandemic our nation is experiencing a significant shortage of poll workers. Sign up to support our democracy and be a poll worker on November 3 here: https://t.co/6kRwcNHIai

.@JacksonCountyHD is hosting FREE #COVID19 testing clinics for both symptomatic and asymptomatic individuals this week. Those who are symptomatic are encouraged to call 404-CARE to schedule a test at one of @TrumanMedKC hospital locations. https://t.co/AFVtYgDH1O
There will be FREE #COVID19 testing at the Fairmount Community Center in @CityofIndepMO today and Thursday. More information here: https://t.co/dGBiLEj3Nl

As the #COVID19 pandemic continues to disproportionately harm communities of color it’s critical that the Fed do everything possible to ensure the economic recovery is equitably distributed.   Proud to be an original cosponsor of this important legislation. https://t.co/StmQBpwqqm

The Paycheck Protection Program is taking applications for forgivable loans until this Saturday (Aug 8th). If you’re a small business who needs #Coronavirus relief make sure you apply here: https://t.co/jv6kzJJcwm

Congressional response to the #COVID19 child care crisis will have ramifications for years to come.   That’s why @HouseDemocrats passed 2 major child care bills that would bring relief to American families.   Now it’s up to the Senate to pass them as well. https://t.co/0NRjXhPKp4

Millions of Americans are on the precipice of homelessness due to the #COVID19 pandemic and the Senate’s lack of urgency in bringing relief to the American people.   Congress must act now! https://t.co/VXKg6KrvC8

Over 25% of rural Americans do not have access to broadband at home. With the #COVID19 pandemic it’s more important than ever that we expand rural broadband so workers can stay connected students can continue learning & patients can still see their doctors. #RuralBroadbandDay

Nonprofits are an important component of the American economy and provide critical resources to underserved communities. That’s why I’m leading the call for Congress to provide additional relief for nonprofits in the next #COVID19 relief package. https://t.co/poZgLYD7Ry

The President’s tweet this morning is a despicably divisive attempt to distract from his utter failure to contain the COVID-19 crisis which has led to 150000 deaths and devastated the American economy.

As Missouri trends in the wrong direction we can't fool ourselves into thinking we’ve defeated #COVID19.   We must unite to defeat this virus & protect our neighbors.   Please continue to stay home when possible practice social distancing & wear a mask! https://t.co/Gfddk5b029

The Neighborhood Investment Act would provide an infusion of $17.9 billion to CDFIs and MDIs to expand the flow of credit to underserved communities that have been hit hardest by #COVID19.  Congress must act #ForThePeople

As we continue to see small businesses shutter and workers lose jobs it’s clear the #COVID19 crisis has had a disproportionate impact on low-income & minority communities.   Congress must provide these communities with much-needed access to capital to prevent further losses.
Missouri is seeing a definitive uptick in #COVID19 cases across the state. For the sake of your friends family and neighbors please wear a mask and practice social distancing! https://t.co/rRVDYuoaLS

“Italy once the poster child of coronavirus devastation and with a population twice that of Texas has recently averaged about 200 new cases a day when Texas has had over 9000.”   We can and MUST do better. https://t.co/skrCDQl8Oh

23 million Americans face eviction in the coming months if Congress fails to pass another #coronavirus relief package.   That’s why @HouseDemocrats included over $100 billion in renters & homeowners assistance in the #HeroesAct.   The Senate must act NOW! https://t.co/b7qdgiySwX

First POTUS wanted to slow down testing to artificially deflate the cases of #COVID19 in America.   Now he wants to hide the numbers altogether.   Putting politics above public health is how we got here. Less transparency will only lead to more pain and suffering. https://t.co/DdNby4gQWO

With millions of workers still unemployed due to #COVID19 it’s critical for Congress and the Administration to extend unemployment benefits so families can stay afloat during this crisis.   That’s why the Senate must pass the #HeroesAct! https://t.co/IPVEuiC4LN

5.4 million Americans have lost health insurance during the #COVID19 pandemic and the Trump Administration is in court right now trying to take it away from 20 million more.   @HouseDemocrats are fighting to #ProtectOurCare. https://t.co/V5E72Ksmmt

Black & Hispanic communities are 3x as likely to contract #COVID19 & 2x as likely to die from the virus.   As Congress continues to debate the next #Coronavirus relief bill we must ensure underserved communities are receiving the resources needed to overcome this deadly virus. https://t.co/hQDtiRS7lO

Putting politics before science and the advice of our public health experts has led to a massive surge in #Coronavirus cases across the nation.   Wear a mask. Social distance. Save lives. https://t.co/QWIWc2L4NP

The battle against #COVID19 is far from over.   Wear a mask.   Save lives.  Pass it on.

It may feel like the danger from the pandemic has dissipated as we open up but this is far from the truth. COVID-19 is not a sprint it’s a marathon. It’s imperative to practice social distancing and wear masks in public to prevent more outbreaks. https://t.co/n2q6VnJtYU

The United States has 5% of the world’s population and 25% of the world’s deaths from #COVID19.   We can and must be better than this. https://t.co/ijdRByxB3f
Denial is not a strategy.   This isn’t a hoax and it’s not going to simply go away.   We need a national plan and leadership at the very top to combat #COVID19 https://t.co/xP3ZBq42j4

1/3 of the jobs lost between February and May could be permanent.   Congress must continue to support American workers and local small businesses before the economic damage done by #COVID19 can’t be undone. #HeroesAct https://t.co/H5asVGVqNv
The U.S. has not won the war against #COVID19.   Not even close.   Please continue to follow social distancing protocols and always wear a mask when in public! https://t.co/d3VDuX1ZCF

There is no racial justice without environmental & healthcare justice to go along w/ it.   As Black communities continue to be disproportionately impacted by #COVID19 we need to take a closer look at how pollution in our cities is leading to worse outcomes for African Americans. https://t.co/SgafUYAmvI

Today the death toll from the Coronavirus has tragically reached 100000. We as a nation have been lessened by their untimely departure.

There is not one single representative senator or mayor who doesn’t want to fully reopen ASAP but we need the infrastructure in place to limit the spread of #COVID19. If China can test millions of people in less than 2 weeks why can’t we? https://t.co/VqV6pWxe3p

Join us tomorrow at 1pm ET for a virtual forum on extremism during the #coronavirus pandemic. Looking forward to the discussion with @RepMaxRose @JgreenblattADL & @Ali_H_Soufan. https://t.co/Hjbr5iC9CG

Last week @HouseDemocrats passed the #HeroesAct to provide: -Cash payments to American families -Direct funding for state & local governments devastated by #COVID19 -Investments in testing and tracing to get our economy reopened safely   Congress needs to act now #ForThePeople
It will extend unemployment benefits until January of next year so that workers devastated by the #COVID19 pandemic can stay afloat until the economy comes back to life. #HeroesAct

We all want to reopen our country. To do so safely & avoid another shutdown Congress must commit critical resources to the testing tracing & treatment of #coronavirus.   @HouseDemocrats’ #HeroesAct will provide communities with the necessary resources to do just that. https://t.co/iL87PhqNwL

Today I voted in favor of the latest #coronavirus relief legislation. While no bill of this magnitude is perfect It’s critical we provide our health care workers and small businesses the support they need during this crisis. https://t.co/qCb4oIQLcO
